===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|かい|り}}
Probably coined in Japan of {{etyl|ltc|-}}-derived elements.

The [[beaver]] is not native to Asia, so this word would have been coined (or repurposed) relatively recently.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=on|かいり|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かいり}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=かいり|rare}} alternate term for {{l|ja|ビーバー|tr=''[[bībā]]''}}: a [[beaver]]

=====Usage notes=====
The term {{ja-r|ビーバー}} is used more commonly.

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|うみ|たぬき|k2=だぬき}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=うみだぬき|海|tr1=umi|t1=sea, ocean|狸|tr2=tanuki|t2=[[tanuki]] or [[raccoon dog]]}}. {{rendaku2|sort=うみだぬき|tanuki|danuki}}<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kun|うみだぬき|acc=3|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|うみだぬき}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=うみだぬき|rare}} alternate term for {{l|ja|ビーバー|tr=''[[bībā]]''}}: a [[beaver]]

=====Usage notes=====
The term {{ja-r|ビーバー}} is used more commonly.
